sources.title: Lady for a Night (1942)
sources.description: Gambling boat operator Jenny Blake throws over her gambler beau Jack Morgan in order to marry into high society. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/lady-for-a-night-1942/

sources.title: Lady for a Night
sources.description: “Murder, music and malice in the old South” “’Gone with the Wind’ on speed” (IMDB reviews quotes). A hodgepodge of a movie that can’t decide if its a romantic comedy, a romantic drama or a musical. Joan Blondell and John Wayne costar, but Wayne really has a supporting role. Hattie Noel is particular fun as Blondell’s no-nonsense maid. The production values are good even though they unbelievably include French cancan dancers from the Folies Bergere. Well it is what it is, so just throw your hands and enjoy. IMDB rating 6.2. Directed by Leigh Jason. Released in 1942. Complete print. TRIVIA: This film was the inspiration for naming the famous WW2 B-17 bomber “Memphis Belle.”

metadata.Plot: Gambling boat operator Jenny Blake throws over her gambler beau Jack Morgan in order to marry into high society.
metadata.Writer: Isabel Dawn, Boyce DeGaw, Garrett Fort
metadata.Actors: Joan Blondell, John Wayne, Philip Merivale
